header.name: Facundo Mourelle
intro.title: Backend & Infrastructure Developer
intro.subtitle: Computer Analyst
intro.description: I focus on server-side logic, distributed systems management, and environment automation. I bridge the gap between rigorous algorithmic analysis and the deployment of scalable, secure, and remote-ready architectures, ensuring high availability and performance
project.title: Featured Projects
project.desc.switcher: Web game featuring real-time bidirectional communication and constant synchronization across multiple clients. It implements session persistence to ensure match recovery during unexpected disconnections. The system includes a chronological flow control engine, enabling state reversibility for move-by-move undo functionality.
project.desc.omnet: Project focused on analyzing simulated network environments using communication protocols. Leveraging OMNeT++ to model interconnected nodes, the study evaluated flow control and congestion issues through performance metrics. A dynamic rate-adaptation algorithm was developed to respond to network congestion, effectively minimizing packet loss and optimizing data throughput.
project.desc.parser: A massive data processing system designed to automate content extraction from multiple web subscriptions and forums. The engine transforms heterogeneous sources into a Resilient Distributed Dataset (RDD/DataFrame), orchestrating a network of Workers to apply filtering heuristics and entity extraction in parallel. The result is a structured data feed that achieves efficient synthesis of scattered information into a unified format.
project.desc.spicetify: An extension made for Spicetify that allows to link together songs in a playlist that should reproduce one after the other in shuffle mode.
